snippet: As the co-host of the Euro 2012 championships, Ukraine had its flagging reputation battered as it endured over four weeks of worldwide attention.
abstract: Kiev Journal; Ukraine, the co-host of the Euro 2012 soccer championships, had its already flagging reputation battered as it endured worldwide attention; even before the tournament started, a number of European countries and institutions had announced that they would boycott over the continued imprisonment of Yulia V Tymoshenko, a former prime minister, on charges widely viewed as political; in the end, the effort to boycott gave way to the political imperative of supporting the national team.
lead_paragraph: As the co-host of the Euro 2012 championships, Ukraine had its flagging reputation battered as it endured over four weeks of worldwide attention.

headline.seo: Ukraine Unable to Kick Its Tattered Reputation
headline.main: A Host Country Is Unable to Kick Its Tattered Reputation
headline.print_headline: A Host Country Is Unable to Kick Its Tattered Reputation
